faqs.question: Is VTone painful?
faqs.answer: No. Most patients describe VTone as a comfortable pulsing sensation. You remain in complete control, and our specialists adjust intensity to your comfort level. Many women find the treatment relaxing.

faqs.question: How soon will I see results?
faqs.answer: Many patients notice improvements in bladder control after a few sessions. Optimal results typically appear after completing the full treatment series of 6-8 sessions, with continued improvement in the weeks following.

faqs.question: Am I a good candidate for VTone?
faqs.answer: VTone is ideal for women experiencing stress urinary incontinence, postpartum pelvic floor weakness, or vaginal laxity. During your consultation, we'll assess your candidacy and discuss whether VTone is right for your specific situation.

faqs.question: Is there any downtime?
faqs.answer: This treatment requires no downtime. You can return to all normal activities, including work, exercise, and intimacy, immediately.

faqs.question: How long do results last?
faqs.answer: With proper maintenance, many women enjoy results for several months to a year or longer. We may recommend periodic maintenance sessions to sustain your improvements.
